article.title: A Millimeter Continuum Size-Luminosity Relationship for Protoplanetary Disks

multiple_choice_question.text: What information is provided in the lower left corner of each panel in Figure 1?
What happens to the Nuker profile as the value of the parameter "a" increases?
choices: The profile becomes smoother and less like a broken power-law
The profile becomes more concentrated towards the center
The profile becomes more extended towards the outer edges
The profile converges to a sharp broken power-law

multiple_choice_question.text: Why is using the transition radius (ρτ) alone as a size metric problematic?
choices: ρτ is not directly related to the amount of flux emitted.
ρτ is difficult to measure accurately with limited resolution.
ρτ  does not adequately reflect the radial distribution of emission for disks with different inner disk indices (γ).
ρτ  is highly dependent on the specific surface brightness profile chosen.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 4 illustrate about the inference of the Nuker profile parameters for the IQ Tau disk?
choices: There are strong degeneracies between all five Nuker profile parameters.
The inner and outer disk indices (γ and β) are very well constrained.
The transition radius (ρτ) and transition index (α) are strongly correlated.
The total flux density (Fν) is the most accurately measured parameter.
